Pre-Game Insights: India needs to level up their midfield if they are to have any chance of coming up with a much-needed win.

The Blue Tigers have to work together like a machine and overcome every single mental block that they will face against an aggressive and physical Syrian side in order to get something out of this match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game against Mauritius saw India play in Hyderabad for the first time in 16 years, and they were disappointed throughout the 90 minutes.
The Syrians are extremely disciplined and are well-oiled in the coaching department.
Others: The Blue Tigers are still adjusting to a brand new system that Manolo Marquez is trying to establish and we think the wait for their first victory under new management is likely to extend.
We think the Indian team will score first, followed by a Syrian comeback later in the game when the Blue Tigersâ€™ defenders get tired.
